message.content:
cs.GR, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses the implementation of technology-sustained pervasive games, which involves the use of computerized representations of physical space and time. This suggests that the paper could belong to the Graphics (cs.GR) or Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper discusses the design of the game interface and the user experience, which could place it in the Human-Computer Interaction (cs.HC) or Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-categories. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed model using a case study, which could suggest that it belongs to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
